snippet: Toyota has surged back from a downturn following the natural disasters in Japan last year and is expecting to sell 23 percent more vehicles than it did in 2011.
abstract: Toyota reports that net profit for the April-to-June quarter rose to 290.3 billion yen, or $3.71 billion, from 1.1 billion yen in the same period a year earlier, after the number of vehicles it sold nearly doubled; company is leading a recovery by Japanese automakers after a year of natural disasters and a punishingly strong currency.
lead_paragraph: Toyota has surged back from a downturn following the natural disasters in Japan last year and is expecting to sell 23 percent more vehicles than it did in 2011.

headline.seo: Toyota Raises Sales Target as Quarterly Profit Rises
headline.main: After Recalls and Woes, Toyota Posts Huge Profit
headline.print_headline: After Recalls And Woes, Toyota Posts Huge Profit
